ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed basic understandings of spanish.
Basic Spanish language skills -- vocabulary, grammar, speaking, etc.
I learned how to speak Spanish correctly... kind of.
A strong foundation to basic Spanish.
I learned Spanish grammar, pronunciations, words, etc.
Basic grammar and a wide range of vocabulary of the Spanish language

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There was adequate time spent on vocab, but I think more time could be spent on utilizing new grammar points.
The course is well organized and provides a lot of support for students. The course could benefit by providing students with more opportunities to practice both their speaking and grammar skills.
This class was great at teaching me the fundamentals of Spanish.
The course is well-taught and well-organized. I think it would be cool if there was more opportunity to practice speaking.

I would recommend more practice tests-- in particular, more practice with the oral and auditory exam in class. Even though we were exposed to those structures before, we weren't really exposed to different accents or comprehensive photographs.
The course moved pretty quickly, but it was easy to follow

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would because Spanish is so useful in today's society. I think everyone should have a good understanding how to speak and write in Spanish.
You get out of it what you put in. But if you are willing to study and review what you are learning on your own, you will learn a lot. Go to office hours if ever confused!
Yas! The teacher is great and I have improved my Spanish greatly.
Absolutely! If you want to learn Spanish this is a great place to do it. Also not that heavy of a course-load.
Yes, If you want to learn Spanish, you will definitely be given the tools to learn the language well.
Yes, it is helpful in understanding the Spanish language and sets a good foundation
